results.title: Yehudi Menuhin at the Barbican [Incomplete]
results.brief_description: This Bach concert is a very special one. Given as part of a tri- centenary tribute to Johann Sebastian Bach, it features the first encounter of the world’s most beloved violinist, Yehudi Menuhin, with a major young talent of the opera stage, 27 year old French baritone, Nicolas Riveng, who, on this occasion, was making his debut and the English Chamber orchestra. The program includes four of Bach’s most popular works. NOTE: Program cuts out at the end.
results.description: This Bach concert is a very special one. The program includes four of Bach’s most popular works. NOTE: Program cuts out at the end.

The program includes four of Bach’s most popular works. NOTE: Program cuts out at the end.

results.title: Yehudi Menuhin and his guru
results.brief_description: One of the most famous practitioners of Yoga today is Yehudi Menuhin who discusses its teachings and aims with David Attenborough. Taking part with him is his Guru (or spiritual teacher) who joins in the discussion and demonstrates some of the unusual exercises prescribed by Yoga.
results.description: One of the most famous practitioners of Yoga today is Yehudi Menuhin who discusses its teachings and aims with David Attenborough. Taking part with him is his Guru (or spiritual teacher) who joins in the discussion and demonstrates some of the unusual exercises prescribed by Yoga.

results.title: Yehudi Menuhin - Brahms violin concerto in D Major, Op. 77
results.creator_credit: Bruno Monsaingeon, Lexi Godfrey, VEB Deutsche Schallplatten and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Gewandhaus in Leipzig on 2nd September 1982. This is a most exquisite performance by Yehudi Menuhin, the internationally acclaimed violinist who is recognised worldwide for his outstanding brilliance. The concerto is preceded by a personal introduction by Yehudi Menuhin and two pieces of unaccompanied Bach make up the encores. He is supported by the Gewandhaus Orchestra conducted by Kurt Masur.
